quest.name: Remember the Texture
journal: Debroye appears to have had a revelation.

Debroye has tasked you with crafting jars of panaloaf yeast.

※Minimum collectability rating for this delivery is 140. Delivering items with a rating of 290 or more will earn greater rewards.
You deliver the panaloaf yeast to Debroye. As before, she asks for some time to cogitate on the problem at hand─a means to add a tantalizing aroma to the next batch of bread.
objectives: Deliver jars of panaloaf yeast to Debroye.

dialogue.name: DEBROYE
dialogue.text: Ah, Forename─my partner in panaloaf improvement!

dialogue.name: DEBROYE
dialogue.text: I've been researching the subject of texture, and I think I've found the cause of our powdery problem.

dialogue.name: DEBROYE
dialogue.text: The answer lies in the yeast. It seems the sugar content of the sweetener weakened its usual effects, preventing the dough from being fully leavened.

dialogue.name: DEBROYE
dialogue.text: Which means that if we can create a yeast more properly suited to sweetened dough, then our bread will be as moist as we care to make it!

dialogue.name: DEBROYE
dialogue.text: Knowing, however, is not quite the same as doing. While I understand the basics, formulating yeast from scratch is rather beyond my current abilities...

dialogue.name: DEBROYE
dialogue.text: Once more, I must call upon you to “rise” to the occasion! Ahem, sorry...

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: The Studium Deliveries list for Debroye has been updated. To view the new list, speak with Debroye.

dialogue.name: DEBROYE
dialogue.text: I'm afraid our bread will never be all that it can be if we cannot solve this yeastly dilemma...

dialogue.name: DEBROYE
dialogue.text: Wonderful! If my reasoning is correct, then this yeast should be compatible with our sweet dough.

dialogue.name: DEBROYE
dialogue.text: Now this is some potent-looking yeast! Trust me, after the hours I spent staring at such things during my studies, the quality is obvious!

dialogue.name: DEBROYE
dialogue.text: Thanks to all your hard work, the third test batch of panaloaf turned out just as moist as we'd hoped!

dialogue.name: DEBROYE
dialogue.text: And all without compromising the original integrity of its nutritional content.

dialogue.name: DEBROYE
dialogue.text: It was well received by the clientele at the Last Stand, and even our difficult-to-please regular gave it his seal of approval.

dialogue.name: DEBROYE
dialogue.text: I would, however, like to hear the opinion of the─to my knowledge─foremost gourmand in Sharlayan.

dialogue.name: DEBROYE
dialogue.text: I speak of Master Dickon, the owner of the Last Stand. Everything I know about gourmet cooking, I owe to that man. Come, why don't we go and see what he has to say?

dialogue.name: DEBROYE
dialogue.text: Master Dickon, what did you think of the third batch?

dialogue.name: DICKON
dialogue.text: Aye, it's a decent loaf, alright.

dialogue.name: DICKON
dialogue.text: Certainly a far cry from what you started with─that very first sample tasted like a sponge fished out of a sewer ditch. I expect you have your new friend to thank for this sudden leap in progress...?

dialogue.name: Q1
dialogue.text: What will you say?

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: Debroye's efforts made all the difference!

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: I swore a vendetta against that foul-tasting evil!

dialogue.name: DEBROYE
dialogue.text: I could hardly have done it alone! Without your practical talents, I would still be stuck daydreaming by the oven.

dialogue.name: DEBROYE
dialogue.text: Oh, my dear Forename, you are a gourmet after my own heart─a crusader for culinary quality!

dialogue.name: DICKON
dialogue.text: Be that as it may, you yet have work to do. You've worked wonders with the taste and the texture, but there's no aroma. It needs a savory scent to draw you in, and set your mouth to watering.

dialogue.name: DEBROYE
dialogue.text: So it isn't...smelly enough.

dialogue.name: DEBROYE
dialogue.text: The road to gastronomic excellence is never-ending, it seems. But if that is what it takes to earn your full approval, then we must bake on!

dialogue.name: DICKON
dialogue.text: Ah, you remind me of old Mervyn. He was the fellow who built this place, and dedicated his life to bringing fine food to Sharlayan.

dialogue.name: DICKON
dialogue.text: That life ended before he'd truly accomplished his goal, and the Last Stand passed on to me. Even now, gourmet cooking remains something of a foreign concept in this nation.

dialogue.name: DICKON
dialogue.text: It's the kind of place where puffed-up experts like your professor label their nutritional experiments the “perfect meal.” As if anything with such a revolting flavor could ever be deemed perfect!

dialogue.name: DICKON
dialogue.text: Listen, the Last Stand was named so for a reason. We're a cultural outpost─the final defense against those who would condemn Sharlayan's diet to blandness and monotony!

dialogue.name: DICKON
dialogue.text: If you share Mervyn's dream─and I believe you do─then I implore you to carry on his legacy!

dialogue.name: DEBROYE
dialogue.text: After hearing what Master Dickon had to say, I'm more determined than ever to make a truly perfected panaloaf!

dialogue.name: DEBROYE
dialogue.text: As before, allow me some time to cogitate on the problem, and then we can see about adding a tantalizing aroma to the next batch of bread.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Debroye is delighted with your efforts. She now considers you an Indispensable Baker!

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: The next request will be available from Debroye upon reaching level 85 as an alchemist or culinarian.
